required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter in Preeclampsia
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Intracranial Pressure With Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter Measurement in Women With or Without Preeclampsia

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Severe preeclampsia is associated with an elevation in intracranial pressure (ICP). Optic nerve sheath diameter is a non-invasive surrogate of invasive ICP measurement. This study targets to evaluate the ICP in patients with or without preeclampsia.

detailed_description.textblock: MRI studies have shown that brain edema due to an elevation in ICP develops in up to 70% of women with preeclampsia. Optic nerve sheath diameter is used to estimate the ICP and has been shown to correlate well with invasive ICP measurement. The present study aims to compare ICP using optic nerve sheath diameter in women with or without preeclampsia.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: The difference in ICP estimated with optic nerve sheath diameter measurement among women with or without preeclampsia

arm_group.description: Patients with preeclampsia will receive optic nerve sheath diameter measurement with a linear ultrasound probe carefully and gently placed on the closed upper eyelids of patients.
Pregnant women without preeclampsia will receive optic nerve sheath diameter measurement with a linear ultrasound probe carefully and gently placed on the closed upper eyelids of patients.

intervention.description: Optic nerve sheath diameter measurement is performed with a linear ultrasound probe placed over the eyelid.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be diagnosed as preeclampsia
- Age must be > 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of previous intracranial pathology or surgery
- Glaucoma

facility.name: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

address.state: Please Enter The State Or Province

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital
